title: (x) Crown Mills Portland, OR wide shaded engraved serif - LTR Federal {Marc O}
content:
This was probably a custom font, but I was hoping someone out there can recommend a modern day equivalent for use in a current project.

Thank you!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20141102215305/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%201_59.png) | 143.36 KB |
author: jonaschafer

comments.content:
Letterror's Federal is the gold standard (pun intended) of currency fonts.

[http://www.letterror.com/catalog/fed/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20141102215305/http:/www.letterror.com/catalog/fed/index.html "http://www.letterror.com/catalog/fed/index.html")

Or try Smackeroo from Nick Curtis:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/smackeroo-nf/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141102215305/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/smackeroo-nf/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/smackeroo-nf/")
Whoops, sorry. I didn't intend to post my signature. Sorry!
Thanks marcox! LTR Federal is pretty much ideal!
